summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List detailing numerous international flights taken by Jeffrey Epstein on private aircraft (tail numbers N212JE, N120JE, N415LM) between 2016 and 2019, primarily between Teterboro, NJ (KTEB), West Palm Beach, FL (KPBI), and St. Thomas, USVI (TIST). The document shows frequent travel patterns in the years leading up to his 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the travel log, listed on numerous private flight entries between 2016 and 2019, often traveling under the name 'Jeffrey Edward Epstein'.

events.title: Epstein's Frequent Private Air Travel
events.description: Numerous private aircraft flights recorded for Jeffrey Epstein between airports in New Jersey, Florida, the US Virgin Islands, and France.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein traveled extensively on private aircraft (tail numbers N212JE, N120JE, N415LM) between 2016 and April 2019.
Primary travel routes connected Teterboro, NJ (KTEB), West Palm Beach, FL (KPBI), and St. Thomas, USVI (TIST), with some flights to/from Paris (LFPB).
The document is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) TECS Person Encounter List generated on April 22, 2019, indicating law enforcement monitoring of his movements.
Epstein sometimes traveled under the full name 'Jeffrey Edward Epstein'.
Flight records show both inbound (I) and outbound (O) travel, processed through CBP at various facilities including private aviation terminals.
